author: Jordan Peterson
author_description: 1962 - present, Canadian clinical psychologist and professor of psychology
author_funny_facts: Jordan Peterson's cat, named 'Dr. Who', has its own Twitter account with over 100k followers.

author: Brene Brown

author_description: c. 600 BC – 530 BC, founder of the Achaemenid Empire
author_funny_facts: Cyrus the Great was known for his love of gardening and reportedly grew a variety of exotic plants and trees at his palace.

author_interesting_facts: Cyrus the Great founded the Achaemenid Empire, which at its height, spanned three continents and was the largest empire in ancient history.
Cyrus the Great was a religiously tolerant ruler who allowed the Jews to return to their homeland and rebuild their temple in Jerusalem.

Cyrus the Great was reportedly killed in battle against the Massagetae, a tribe from Central Asia led by their queen Tomyris. Tomyris is said to have killed Cyrus and then had his head cut off and placed in a wine skin filled with human blood as revenge for the death of her son in an earlier battle with Cyrus.
author_inspiring_facts: Cyrus the Great is known for his famous Cylinder, a document considered by many to be the first declaration of human rights. In it, Cyrus proclaims the rights of all people to worship their own gods and follow their own customs without fear of persecution.
Cyrus the Great was known for his military prowess and strategic thinking, but also for his compassion and kindness towards his subjects.
Cyrus the Great's legacy as a ruler who valued diversity, tolerance, and justice continues to inspire people around the world today.

author: Stephen Covey
author_funny_facts: Stephen Covey was born on October 24, 1932, which is also the United Nations Day. So, he was destined to become a great leader.
Stephen Covey was not just a leadership guru, he was also a devout Mormon. He served as a missionary in England for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.
Stephen Covey’s famous book ‘7 Habits of Highly Effective People’ has been translated into 40 languages. But, Covey himself spoke only English and French.
author_interesting_facts: Before becoming a leadership expert, Stephen Covey trained as a lawyer. He received a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from the University of Utah, as well as a Juris Doctor degree from Harvard Law School.
Stephen Covey co-founded the FranklinCovey company, which provides leadership training and consulting services to businesses and organizations worldwide.
Stephen Covey was named one of Time Magazine’s 25 most influential Americans in 1996.
author_inspiring_facts: Stephen Covey believed in the power of personal responsibility and self-improvement. He once said, “I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.”

Stephen Covey stressed the importance of prioritizing and focusing on the most important things in life. He said, “The key is not to prioritize what’s on your schedule, but to schedule your priorities.”

Stephen Covey believed in the importance of building strong relationships and treating others with respect. He said, “Trust is the glue of life. It’s the most essential ingredient in effective communication. It’s the foundational principle that holds all relationships.”

author_interesting_facts: Brian Tracy was born in Canada, but he now lives in San Diego, California.

author_inspiring_facts: Brian Tracy believes that anyone can achieve success if they are willing to work hard and learn from their mistakes.

Brian Tracy encourages people to take control of their lives and not let fear or self-doubt hold them back from achieving their dreams.

author: Thomas Edison
author_funny_facts: Thomas Edison was afraid of the dark.
He once told a reporter he had no hobbies because he was too busy inventing.
Edison's favorite movie was The Great Train Robbery.
author_interesting_facts: Edison held over 1,000 patents for his inventions.
He invented the phonograph, the motion picture camera, and the incandescent light bulb.
Edison's first job was selling newspapers on a train at the age of 12.
author_inspiring_facts: Edison once said, 'I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.'
He was known for his perseverance and determination in the face of failures.
Edison believed in the power of hard work and once said, 'Genius is 1% inspiration and 99% perspiration.'
